title: Master Seminar Entrepreneurship Theory and Practice
headtitle: Master Seminar Entrepreneurship Theory and Practice
lehrinhalte:
Entrepreneurial core competencies and skills in start-ups, SME and family businesses; 
Peculiarities of the start-up and the growth phase, 
Business Planning: Instruments and Cases, 
Support Institutions, Support Programs, Start-up Consulting for Start-Ups and Business Succession:
beurteilung:
Quality of papers and empirical field work (f.i. interviews,
quality of presentations,
tests):
voraussetzungen:
(*)Positive Absolvierung der Module

  • Strategic Management
  • Marketing
  • Organization
  • Human Resource & Change Management
  • Managerial Accounting
methoden: Lecture, presentations, group work, seminar papers, field work:
literatur:
Volkmann, C. et al.: Enterpreneurship in a European Perspective. Gabler. Wiesbaden 2010.
Shane, S.: A General Theory of Entrepreneurship. Edward Elgar. Cheltenham 2007.
Hisrich, R. et al.: Entrepreneurship. McGrawHill Irwin. New York 2005.   (6th ed.)
Additional books and papers will be announced at the beginning of the course.
